projects.description: Portfolio site made with Node.js, Express and Pug, setting up a server, handling requests, working with server-side JavaScript, and building a powerful and modern back end project. Pug templates & JSON to generate the markup that is ultimately displayed in the browser.

An app for a fictional company called Awesome Startup, a distributed company with remote employees working all over the world. They need a smart way for employees to share contact information with each other. Using the Random User Generator API (https://randomuser.me/) to grab information for 12 random “employees” and using that data to build a prototype for an Awesome Startup employee directory. Modal window displays extended details

Browser-based, word guessing game: "Phrase Hunter." Using JavaScript and Object-Oriented Programming to select a random, hidden phrase, which a player tries to guess, by clicking letters on an onscreen keyboard or physical computer keyboard.
Interactive registration form enhanced with JavaScript &  jQuery. Validating user input only with JavaScript. Form provides error message that changes depending on the error (email) or in real time.

Web page list pagination, filtering & search with "vanilla" JavaScript. Includes searchbar to filter items from list. Displays clickable navigation links, showing max 10 items at a time. Flexible design, works with lists of diffierent lengths. Displays a message if no matches are found.
App that displays random quote each time a button is clicked. When quote changes, background color changes randomly. Quote is auto-refreshed every 20s
